Good evening. EK participates in the National School Lunch Program. Families of students who receive free or reduced lunches under the program were eligible to receive EBT cards through the federal program back in the spring to cover costs of breakfast and lunches during the pandemic.

School districts just received word from the Ohio Department of Education that the program has been extended to schools under certain conditions for a short period of time. Eligibility varies from school district to school district depending on how districts are educating students. For example, students attending in-class instruction are not eligible whereas students learning online in traditional school districts are eligible.

ODE is again asking school districts to provide information regarding eligible students under the provided guidelines. The East Knox School District Administration is working in cooperation with ODE to ensure those authorities have the information they need to ensure benefits are received by those who are eligible.

As always, thanks for your time.

The OH Report
April 22 at 4:15 PM ¬∑

School districts all over the state recognized their graduating seniors by lighting up Ohio football, baseball and soccer stadiums on the 20th minute of the 20th hour of the 20th day of the month for approximately 20 minutes and 20 seconds.

With the novel coronavirus forcing students out of the classroom while shutting down sports and affecting traditional senior experiences like commencement and prom, the stadium lights gesture was intended to create a positive memory the class of 2020 could remember that was unique to them.

The OH.Report asked fans to submit pictures of their favorite team's stadiums lit up during the honorary ceremony and we received submissions from all over the Buckeye State.

Enjoy this compilation of entries that features high school stadiums across Ohio lit up in recognition of their seniors.

Thanks to everyone who submitted a photo on Ohio High school Football

With the novel coronavirus forcing students out of the classroom while shutting down sports and affecting traditional senior experiences like commencement and prom, the stadium lights gesture was intended to create a positive memory the class of 2020 could remember that was unique to them.

The OH.Report asked fans to submit pictures of their favorite team's stadiums lit up during the honorary ceremony and we received submissions from all over the Buckeye State.

Enjoy this compilation of entries that features high school stadiums across Ohio lit up in recognition of their seniors.
